basics.name: Yuechuan (Mike) Chen
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Hi there, I'm Mike. A Software Engineer passionate about solving problems in innovative ways. I have recently graduated from McGill University and have returned from an exciting trip to Mexico and Guatemala. Look no further if you are a company or startup looking for full stack developer specialized in the MERN stack. Shoot me an email or give me a call and we can have a friendly chat!

work.summary: Responsible for implementing application logic, QA testing and code refactoring for the LORIS platform
highlights: Refactored a portion of the platform to improve code consistency and ease of development.

work.summary: Started my own consulting team to assist the development of a FDA electronic application software for a pharmaceutical consulting company.
highlights: Responsibilities include but not limit to client communication, requirement gathering and management.

work.summary: Implemented an AR front end and back end with Unity, Android, GoLang and MySQL in a team of 3. The application seeks to help firefighters better communicate and become more aware of the ambient environment.
highlights: Implemented parts of the AR application running on the Android platform.
Implemented and maintained some portions of the web and video server in GoLang.

work.summary: Developed various prototypes for PTC using various technologies. Several of which were well received by the clients and were demonstrated on the annual PTC LiveWorx Conference.
highlights: Responsible for building an AR prototype on Android as the front end to a warehouse management system.
Experiences include developing for Android, IOS, and Nodejs.

work.summary: Responsible for analyzing data generated by the real time localization system using matlab, bash and java.
highlights: Also responsible for debugging the web interface built with Javascript, PHP and HTML.
Presented and demonstrated the result at various McGill Hosted conferences.
